title.rendered: The Real Difference in Co-Living vs. Living With Roommates

content.rendered:
Are you “co-living” with someone, or are you just roommates? Did you ever even consider that there might be a difference? As our lifestyle has progressed, so has the way we live, work and even drive a car.

Though it’s not a new concept, the term “co-living” is a relatively new one. It works in a similar way to the “co-working culture” which has transformed offices around the world. In a world where employees were previously cooped up in their own cubicles, most offices are now more open-plan. Separate businesses too can sit side-by-side in a more collaborative environment.

Similarly, co-living is a sharing lifestyle that includes sharing a space or values. For example, they know exactly which Netflix shows are the best ones to watch.

To differentiate between co-living and living with roommates, Roomi reached out to some businesses in the industry. Let’s understand these trends better together.

Aya’s story – Living with roommates makes living better altogether

Aya provides trendy furnished private rooms in the most desirable areas of New York City. They help their community to find a space near everything that matters to them. Bonus: these spaces are shared with amazing roommates.

Aya has various locations in Manhattan and Brooklyn. Options span over East Village, Midtown, Harlem, Williamsburg, and Bushwick. You can choose from an impeccable portfolio of private rooms for any budget, starting at only $800 per month.

They answer some of our questions about what living with roommates really means.

What does the term “co-living” mean to you?

At Aya, we are especially geared towards the room rental market over the co-living market. Accordingly, the concept of room rentals through Aya Live Together is a modern form of housing. Here, residents share a living space and sometimes the same interests and values.

Aya members are often similar in age. Many are also working towards bettering themselves personally and professionally in the hustle and bustle of New York City. 

Why is co-living on the rise in the United States?

The concept of co-living has existed for over 200 years. People often shared apartments and common spaces like the kitchen and living room. However, the unique experience of finding a suitable living arrangement online has never existed before. AND in a location you actually prefer? Mind-blowing.

Combining the old concept of shared spaces with the efficacy of the internet has helped modernize the process. As a result, co-living is now even more common in the U.S. 

How has COVID-19 affected people’s feelings towards co-living?

We see that people are more comfortable living with other people in a shared space than ever before. However, COVID-19 has forced the transition to a more virtual process. This means both AYA and potential customers are moving quicker. 

What’s the difference between co-living and living with roommates?

When co-living or renting rooms, amenities are typically included. You may have the flexibility to lease for short or long term. Co-living properties are typically furnished in the common areas and bedrooms.

Additionally, Aya’s properties offer a natural community where residents can hang together in the backyard or on rooftops. 

Dwellaby – Living Made Simple

Dwellaby describes itself as the next-level co-living. Therefore, featured are the largest rooms on the market, fully-furnished, with free WiFi, utilities, and beyond.

What does the term “co-living” mean to you?

To me, co-living means taking that first step towards independence. Subsequently, you find your space at an affordable price, meet new people, and possibly a new friend for life is priceless. Co-living is not just living with roommates in an apartment or a house – it’s sharing life experiences.

Why is co-living on the rise in the US?

Unless you find that dream job being on your own is not exactly cheap. However, it’s a necessary step in our lives. Coliving is a solution when you want to live independently but can’t actually afford to. For the millions of Americans who go through this struggle, it is a gamechanger.

How has COVID-19 affected people’s feelings towards co-living?

People don’t feel safe around others at the moment. Many don’t know how living with roommates could truly be during a pandemic. Have they been taking the necessary precautions during this pandemic?

All these things can be a little worrisome, but what most of us landlords or roommates are doing is asking those new tenants for a recent negative Covid-19 test or for them to get one before moving in. This way we ensure everyone’s safety and set their minds at ease.

What’s the difference between “co-living” and “living with roommates”?

Unlike the traditional roommate situation, co-living adapts to your schedule. By offering flexible lease terms,we make it work for our tenants. Doesn’t matter if you need to stay for four months or a year.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers understand better coliving with roommates? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
